META.graphic_title: Eight times in two decades chain restaurants have made Americans sick
META.prose: E. coli is the most common culprit, but a hepatitis A outbreak was the most widespread

POISONING.title: Chipotle
POISONING.body: In 2015, Chipotle was responsible for a norovirus outbreak in Simi Valley, CA that sickened 243 people, 54 cases of salmonella in Minnesota and Wisconsin, 143 victims of a norovirus outbreak in Boston and 60 cases of E. coli across 11 states.

POISONING.title: Jimmy John's
POISONING.body: 9 people stricken with E. coli from cucumbers in Denver.

POISONING.title: Taco Bell
POISONING.body: 71 customers in 5 states fell victim to E. Coli from California-grown lettuce.

POISONING.title: Chi-Chi's
POISONING.body: 640 people are sticken by hepatitis A after consuming Mexican spring onions in Monaca, PA. Four people died from the outbreak

POISONING.title: Sizzler
POISONING.body: Watermelon cross-contaminated by raw meat spreads E. coli to 64 people in Wisconsin.

POISONING.title: Kentucky Fried Chicken
POISONING.body: 18 people got E. coli at four Cincinatti locations from coleslaw

POISONING.title: Burger King
POISONING.body: 16 people in Colorado are sickened by E. Coli leading to a recall of 25 million pounds of beef
